summary: Discover the joys and challenges of cycling through New York City with Ryan and Clarence as they explore various boroughs and cycling infrastructure.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a bike-sharing station, highlighting the digital display and keypad used for renting bikes. The scene transitions to a person riding a blue bike through a bustling city street, with the text "BY" appearing on the screen, possibly indicating the start of a journey or a brand name. The rider, wearing a blue shirt and a backpack, navigates through the urban environment, passing by pedestrians and vehicles. The video then shifts to a construction site where workers in high-visibility vests are actively engaged in roadwork, surrounded by traffic cones and construction equipment. The focus returns to the rider, who is seen speaking to the camera, likely sharing their experience or thoughts about the journey. The background features a park-like setting with benches and trees, providing a contrast to the urban and construction scenes. The video wraps up with the rider continuing to speak, gesturing with their hands, and the camera capturing the serene park environment, emphasizing the blend of urban and natural settings throughout the journey.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with the sound of a bicycle chain, presumably coming from a bike engine, followed by a male voice stating it's a "loud place to ride a bike." A different, more conversational male voice introduces himself and explains he's in a park in New York City, and will show how to get around by bicycle. The clip ends with ambient music playing in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a blue shirt and backpack standing in a park, surrounded by trees and benches, as he speaks to the camera. The scene transitions to a bustling city street, where a red double-decker bus adorned with an American flag design is parked. The camera captures the vibrant urban environment, filled with pedestrians, taxis, and other vehicles. A man in a gray t-shirt with the text "BEST DAY EVER" rides a bicycle through the busy streets, passing by various storefronts and billboards, including one for "The School of Rock." The video then shows a close-up of the cyclist's feet pedaling a blue Citi Bike, followed by a wider shot of the cyclist riding down a tree-lined street, with cars and buses visible in the background. The video concludes with a view of a busy intersection, showcasing the dynamic and lively atmosphere of the city.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing cycling in New York, acknowledging perceptions of it being chaotic yet arguing that it's a great place to bike due to advocacy and bike lanes, describing the experience as exhilarating, fun, and safe. The speech abruptly cuts to a musical interlude with a hip-hop flavor, featuring a catchy drum beat, and a groovy bassline. The clip concludes with the male speaker introducing a friend named Clarence Eckerson Junior.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two men standing on a busy city street, engaged in a conversation. The man on the left is wearing bright orange sunglasses and a blue shirt, while the man on the right is dressed in a dark blue polo shirt. They are positioned near a crosswalk, with pedestrians and vehicles visible in the background, indicating a bustling urban environment. The man on the right gestures with his hand as he speaks, while the man on the left listens attentively. The text "CLARENCE ECKERSON JR. WWW.STREETFILMS.ORG" appears on the screen, identifying the man on the right and providing a website link. The scene captures the dynamic atmosphere of city life, with people walking, cars passing by, and the two men seemingly discussing something of interest. The video maintains a consistent focus on the interaction between the two men, with the urban setting providing a lively backdrop.
events_list.audio_caption: Two male speakers are conversing in a cheerful tone about highlighted transportation projects all over the world, mentioning that one speaker knows New York City very well, especially the bike lanes, and has a "rad bike." One male speaker says, "That's for my kid or it's for you maybe." The other male speaker agrees and says, "I think I should sit right there, what do you think?" One male speaker then asks where they are going to roll to today, and the other male speaker responds they are in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, so they are going to see a few things there and then head to Queens. Then, they may head over to Manhattan to see a little bit. Both speakers are excited as they end by saying, "All right, so we're going to get." The ambient sounds of traffic and the outdoors are heard in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a blue Citi Bike, highlighting its digital display and branding. The scene transitions to a wider shot of a row of Citi Bikes parked at docking stations, with a text overlay stating "60 MILLION BIKE TRIPS HAVE BEEN TAKEN SINCE CITI BIKE LAUNCHED IN 2013." A person is seen riding a Citi Bike along a city street, passing by modern high-rise buildings. The video then features an interview with a man wearing a maroon jacket with a New Balance logo and a patch that reads "NYC CITY MARATHON 2017." The scene shifts to a close-up of a Citi Bike's seat with a sticker that reads "My other bike is a WORK-IN-PROGRESS," followed by a person riding the bike through an urban area. The video continues with another interview segment featuring a man in a blue shirt and orange sunglasses, standing on a city street with a grocery store in the background. The final scenes show the man riding the bike through a busy city street, passing by pedestrians and vehicles, with a backdrop of modern buildings and a construction site. The video captures the essence of urban cycling and the popularity of Citi Bike in the city.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker mentioning "city bike" rides, reporting record daily usage. Ambient sounds of traffic and general urban life suggest an outdoor environment. Instrumental hip-hop music begins, setting a reflective mood. The male speaker returns, reflecting on changes to the local environment over the past 20 years, emphasizing waterfront access improvements. Light-hearted background chatter briefly interrupts the hip-hop track. The male speaker remarks about possibly seeing Christopher Walken in a light-hearted tone. Another male speaker briefly corroborates this possibility. Suddenly, the first speaker loudly imitates a crash, apparently involving a delivery truck blocking a bike lane. The hip-hop music becomes louder again, followed by a speaker, seemingly irritated by the issue, addressing another person named Clarence, now riding on a bridge.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a blue shirt and glasses riding a bicycle on a city street, passing by a white car and a truck. The scene transitions to a man in a maroon jacket with a logo, standing on a sidewalk and talking to the camera, with a cyclist in the background. The man in the blue shirt continues riding, passing a yellow taxi and a cyclist in a blue shirt. The video then shows a close-up of the man in the maroon jacket, followed by a scene of two men in suits and hats conversing on a city street. The man in the blue shirt is seen again, riding past a white car and a truck, with a close-up of his face and a black backpack. The video concludes with the man in the blue shirt riding past a parked car and a building with a sign that reads "Battery-Alternator Motor Starter" (a sign indicating a business that provides automotive services). The video captures the dynamic urban environment, with cyclists navigating the streets and pedestrians engaging in conversation, highlighting the bustling city life.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker recounting how the Pulaski Bridge was redesigned a few years ago. He mentions advocacy for bicycle and pedestrian lanes, praising the improved route between Brooklyn and Queens. Suddenly, rhythmic music begins, blending hip-hop elements with a somewhat frantic, energetic tone. Another male interjects with "Are we in Queens, dude?", followed by, "We'll be in Queens in exactly three, two, one!". The music then intensifies, almost drowning out another short snippet of movie dialogue between two men. This is followed by ambient sounds suggesting an outdoor urban environment, and a car. The male voice returns briefly, noting some natural elements, perhaps vegetation, in this urban setting.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a navy blue polo shirt and glasses is seen riding a bicycle on a city street. He is gesturing with his hands as he talks, possibly explaining something about the surroundings. The background features a green construction barrier with the text "POST NO BILLS" (a warning against posting advertisements) and orange and white striped barriers. The man continues to ride his bike, passing by a cityscape with tall buildings and a clear blue sky. He then rides along a bridge with a white railing, overlooking the city skyline and a body of water. The video captures the man's journey through the urban environment, highlighting the contrast between the bustling city life and the serene waterfront view.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker enthusiastically saying, "It's really cool because..." He describes the construction of businesses and residential towers and the prior installment of protected bike lanes. He expresses the opinion that infrastructure should be built before people move in to avoid complaints. As he finishes speaking, some rhythmic pop music starts, setting a casual and upbeat mood. After a pause, the same male speaker returns with a positive tone, exclaiming, "This is so cool," and describing the scene as an "observation deck overlooking Manhattan". The overall soundscape includes continuous ambient background noise, which suggests an urban environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a navy blue polo shirt standing on a wooden deck overlooking a city park with lush greenery and a river in the background. He appears to be speaking, gesturing with his hands, and wearing glasses. The scene transitions to a panoramic view of the city skyline across the river, showcasing tall buildings and a bridge. The camera then shifts to a closer view of the riverbank, highlighting a grassy area with a winding path and a rocky shoreline. The man is then seen riding a blue bicycle on a city street, wearing an orange helmet and sunglasses, and gesturing as he speaks. The video captures various urban settings, including a tree-lined street and a bridge, with the man continuing to ride his bicycle and engage with the surroundings. The video concludes with a close-up of the man's face, showing his orange sunglasses and a city street with pedestrians and storefronts in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: A man describes the waterfront in Queens, mentioning Gantry State Park and environmentally friendly design for rising seas, with accessibility for recreation and protective bike lanes. Background city noise and ambient outdoor sounds accompany the speech. Music, characterized by a laid-back, jazzy hip-hop instrumental with a strong drum beat and subtle bassline, plays in the background. The man observes a truck in the bike lane, expressing concern and joking about whether to hit it. The music continues underneath a transition to a "little greenway" carved out by NYC DOT and Parks for safe access to the Queensboro Bridge. He then clarifies, humorously emphasizing, that it is not the Ed Koch Bridge, a name he hasn't heard anyone use. The music persists as the man describes a climb over the bridge and the amenities of First Avenue, particularly the protected bike lane. The music continues in the background. He comments on someone he spots with a surfboard, noting they're going to have a great day. He explains that the wide lanes accommodate wheelchairs and scooters.

events_list.video_caption: The video captures a vibrant urban scene, starting with a person in a blue shirt and orange sunglasses, wearing a backpack, riding a bike through a city street lined with tall buildings and lush green trees. The atmosphere is lively, with pedestrians and cyclists sharing the road. The scene transitions to a park-like area where a man in a navy blue polo shirt stands near a green traffic light, surrounded by greenery and a pathway. The video then shifts to a group of children riding bicycles, wearing helmets and colorful clothing, with a park setting in the background. The focus returns to the person in the blue shirt, now riding alongside other cyclists, with the park's greenery and a few pedestrians visible. The video concludes with the person in the blue shirt riding through a bustling city street, passing by tall buildings, cars, and other cyclists, capturing the dynamic energy of urban life.
events_list.audio_caption: Two male speakers express relief at being in Central Park, contrasting it with the "madness of Manhattan". One speaker mentions that Central Park was made car-free just last year after a long period of advocacy, and that the park provides peace of mind for city residents, describing it as "the wonderful quiet oasis". One of the men expresses a drop in heart rate due to the environment and states "everything is better in Central Park". He notes the positive effects of nature on human well-being, animals, and mentions seeing birds flying overhead. The scene is punctuated with the sound of bicycle bells and a passing truck. One of the speakers mentions picking up his "little boy" and expresses his enthusiasm with a "Yeah". The men then remark on a "Love More" bicycle that is out for "Pride Week" and express their desire to celebrate. One of the men notices another truck passing by.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a white bicycle chained to a pole, adorned with red flowers, symbolizing a memorial. The scene transitions to a man in a blue shirt and orange sunglasses, standing on a sidewalk with a bicycle, engaging in conversation with another man in a dark shirt and helmet. The background features a cityscape with trees and a bridge. A sign reading 'CYCLIST KILLED HERE REST IN PEACE' with a website URL is shown, indicating a tribute to a fallen cyclist. The man in the blue shirt continues to speak, with the other man and a child in a yellow shirt and helmet visible in the background. The narrative progresses to a man in a dark shirt and helmet pointing at a framed picture on a brick wall, suggesting a connection to the memorial. The man in the blue shirt is then seen with the child on a bicycle, riding along a bike path with a cityscape in the background. The video concludes with the man and child riding together, emphasizing the importance of safety and remembrance in cycling.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a male speaker explaining ghost bikes, white-painted bikes left as memorials, and how cities have made them official monuments. He emphasizes the importance of caution while biking, especially in cities like New York. The scene transitions to music with a groovy, upbeat vibe, featuring a prominent bass line. Background sounds of city traffic, including vehicle noises and possibly a bicycle, accompany the music. As the music fades slightly, the interaction between two men is captured. One man notices "your boy", to which the other confirms "That's my boy." There's a brief greeting to "Clarence", before the male speaker talks about enjoying bikes with children. He talks about interacting with your kid on a bicycle, and how they get to see nature, feel the weather, and are not restricted to a car. Another "hi" is said, then the music returns in the background to end the recording.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man riding a bicycle on a bridge, wearing an orange helmet and a dark blue shirt, with a child in a white helmet seated behind him. The child is wearing a blue jacket with black stripes and a backpack. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man and child, with the man holding the child in his arms. The child is wearing a blue jacket with black stripes and a yellow shirt underneath. The man is wearing a dark blue shirt and glasses. The background shows greenery and a wooden bench. The man and child are smiling and interacting with each other. The man then speaks to the camera, with the child still in his arms. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text 'SUBSCRIBE FOR MORE ADVENTURES' and 'CHECK OUT CLARENCE'S TRANSPORTATION FILMS AT WWW.STREETFILMS.ORG' in white letters.
events_list.audio_caption: The scene begins with a male speaker, sounding casual and conversational, describing that he and his companion are hanging out in a "little parklet". A second male speaker chimes in, noting the space was created by taking over parking spots to create a cozy place. The first speaker then expresses his appreciation, stating, "Give Brian a big hug". This exchange is followed by the sound of an embrace. The first speaker thanks someone named "buddy", followed by a child's voice saying "Thank you fluffy".  The first speaker then remarks on having a playdate, suggesting it was unplanned but appreciated. He notes that it was great to see three boroughs in three hours, highlighting the many things going on. He expresses gratitude for being shown a piece of the other person's world. The second speaker responds, reiterating that it's fun, stating, "New York has a long way to go and is a little troubled in areas to ride" but emphasizes that knowing the right places allows for safe navigation. The first speaker agrees, recommending getting a city bike to explore, advising to ride carefully. He ends on a positive note, stating they "didn't get hit by any cars today".  A soft instrumental jazz tune begins, creating a mellow, reflective mood. The song features brass instruments and accompanies the transition from conversational speech to a more atmospheric setting.
